Systematic Analysis of University Libraries .A Raffel, J.A. As the administrators and librarians on every campus know, limited resources force hard choices among many desirable schemes for expanding and improving library facilities.  What percentage of new books should be acquired, how much service should be provided, how luxurious or austere should new library buildings be? .X 4	1	1400 5	1	1400 24	1	1400 62	1	1400 65	1	1400 66	1	1400 74	1	1400 75	1	1400 76	1	1400 83	1	1400 137	1	1400 178	3	1400 206	2	1400 207	2	1400 208	1	1400 210	1	1400 245	7	1400 249	2	1400 266	1	1400 267	1	1400 273	1	1400 277	1	1400 278	1	1400 279	2	1400 280	1	1400 282	1	1400 287	1	1400 288	2	1400 291	2	1400 292	1	1400 311	1	1400 331	2	1400 350	1	1400 364	1	1400 381	1	1400 386	1	1400 395	1	1400 398	1	1400 406	1	1400 408	5	1400 490	1	1400 494	1	1400 496	1	1400 500	1	1400 515	1	1400 591	3	1400 592	1	1400 658	1	1400 716	1	1400 723	1	1400 724	1	1400 748	1	1400 766	1	1400 782	1	1400 787	1	1400 788	1	1400 789	1	1400 792	1	1400 811	1	1400 816	1	1400 834	1	1400 837	1	1400 840	1	1400 842	1	1400 860	1	1400 865	1	1400 915	1	1400 916	1	1400 925	11	1400 948	1	1400 957	2	1400 959	3	1400 960	3	1400 961	2	1400 962	4	1400 963	1	1400 964	2	1400 972	1	1400 976	3	1400 982	1	1400 984	1	1400 1005	1	1400 1007	2	1400 1019	1	1400 1033	1	1400 1083	1	1400 1148	1	1400 1227	1	1400 1232	1	1400 1236	1	1400 1317	4	1400 1353	2	1400 1358	2	1400 1359	2	1400 1360	2	1400 1361	1	1400 1365	1	1400 1400	22	1400 1401	1	1400 1402	1	1400 1404	1	1400 1410	1	1400 1416	1	1400 1417	1	1400 1424	1	1400 1424	1	1400
